If you think about it, the stereotype for women in this arena is in their late 30's-40's with a male in his early to mid-twenties. So let's assume these general points are true... Why do men lust after teenagers and women after young adults?

You have the older men who are supposed to have some fucking common sense...And how about a little fucking compassion, because these girls are not adults, therefore they can't be expected to think like adults, they may not be as naive as I was when I was a teenager, but still, that does not give anyone the right to take advantage of them...not to mention thinking with your brain instead of your dick to realize all the legal trouble...Plus, how fucking creepy is that to have never met someone before and expect the first time you see them to fuck'em...anyway... I finally figured this crap out, with no thanks to you clowns. Someone will have to tell me how to do this crap again. Well, I'm feeling the pressure of posting a great blog so hear it goes...I was born into the Slaw family farming business back in the good old year of 1982 (I'm only 22 you crazy fuckers). Summers at the Slaw family farm were always nice. I'd help milk the chickens and watch the cows peck. Or wait a minute, oh yeah, we didn't have animals, only grain. So I helped grow the crops and kept a close eye on the roosters because we had a profitable rooster business with this local family called 'The Peters'. Apparently they had a young daughter who absolutely loved roosters of any shape and size. The daughter's name was 'Fonda'. Fonda Peters loved roosters as previously mentioned. When she was young, she used to grab the roosters and stroke them violently until they became 'physically ill'. As the young girl Fonda matured, she eventually learned the proper way to treat a rooster. She learned how to properly groom and care for her roosters. However, she had so many roosters, that infection became rampant among the rooster community. This infection was later to be determined as to what is now known as 'The Clap'. The Clap as we now know it, was begun by the curiosity of Ms. Fonda Peter's favorite rooster which is now known to be referred to as 'Andy the Rooster'. Andy the Rooster had spread his wings into a few too many chicken coops in his time, and had contracted the infectious disease from what scientists now call the species the 'BlockedTheRockALotumus'. The species known as the 'BlockedTheRockALotumus' seemed to have caused incessant liquifaction of the visual membanes of the poor, unfortunate 'Andy the Rooster'. As Andy the Rooster dehydrated and lay dying from the incessant liquification of his visual membranes, he was able to share these last few words with the rooster loving Fonda Peters. 'Fonda' he said, 'I always loved to peck around your beautifully shapen feet, and when you think of me, I pray that you remember me for my more loving rooster characteristics although I was never fully able to share it because of contracting The Clap from what has been explained to me as the devil chickens.' Sorry to create my first blog on such a down note, but I thought I might help the communication process if everyone knew where I was coming from. Biography is soon to follow....

Once upon a time, when nuts and berries grew wild and free and grass was kept short with gleaming shears, a little tail wagged and our story began... Norma swatted again at the fly buzzing around her. Her tail flew up and out and over and up again. Her ears followed suit. Louie glanced up from his meal to see the wagging of Norma's tail. He interpreted the swat as a friendly wag and frolicked over to the fence. "Norma, my sweet!" he began but was interrupted by the little chirps of Viv and Micky, the newborn chicks. "Cheep chirp chiroo! Micky, get out!" cried Viv. "Chip cheep chirp! I will not not not!" replied Micky obstinately. "Louie! Norma!" cried Viv. "Olaf!" She even applauded to the butterfly. Louie turned back to Norma, who had hopped up on the fence to see what all the fuss was about. "Oh dear," thought Louie, impressed by Norma's skills. Suddenly, (i.e. without warning) Olaf the butterfly began to laugh maniacally (as well as without restraint) "That is it!" yelled Olaf in a fake Polish accent. "They are here!" He began to swoop around aimlessly in the air. Viv and Micky fell silent. Louie fainted. Norma hopped off the fence and ate a nearby daisy. "That's right, Olaf," she said. "We are here." Without another word, Norma gobbled up Olaf and continued grazing. Life went on. Unitl, of course, it stopped. At which time they ceased to exist and well anyway... The end. Wait, they lived happily ever after first. And then finally, the end!

Having spent many, many restless days in the past three years picking away at popcorn kernels stuck in the soles of my shoes, washing out the grease of it from my hair, and smelling like it for days on end, I believe I now know enough about this "wonderful" snack to write a little something in its honor... Ode to Popcorn... Oh, Popcorn, you're so hot, As you burn and sizzle in the kettle pot. You smell like butter on a summer's day, That doesn't really make sense but anyway... Your yellow glow warms my heart, As your greasy oil stains my shirt. With oil and heat and stirring you 'pop!' And some of it jumps out and burns me right in the freakin' face-- Ahem. Popcorn, popcorn, what would I do, If I didn't have to smell like you. All day long I reek of your scent, I forgot what good cleanliness meant. You munch and crunch, My day away, As I sit doing alarms, And turn old and gray. About the stupid customers, Who complain about price, I wish I could smack them, That would be nice. I can eat popcorn one by one, Or handfulls at a time. I love your buttery goodness, I wish you only cost a dime. Popcorn, pocorn, my bestest friend, Threatening my complexion till the bitter end.

I opened up the Manila envelope as quickly as I could, hoping that it was an unexpected Christmas present. I reached in, and to my displeasure, pulled out what appeared to be a dead cat. The cat had a Post-it-note on it that read "How many Pollocks does it take to kill your cat? That bastard! I knew he was going to try to get me back for sleeping with his mom. As quickly as I could, I ran over to the cabinet and pulled out a large white envelope. I then proceeded to pull my pants down to my knees, squat, and took a shit in the envelope which I was holding open with both hands. Sealing it, however, was a problem. I should have purchased self-adhesive envelopes because getting my tongue close enough to lick the envelope almost made me lose my lunch. Finally, though, I persevered and addressed the envelope, but not before I dropped a Post-it-note inside that read "Shits-n-giggles. Oops! Forgot the giggles." Once I had mailed the envelope, I started to ponder my decision. It actually was pretty shitty of me to sleep with his mom. God, what did I have to go and do that for? Upon acknowledging my mistake, I grabbed the jug of Kool-Aid out of the fridge and ran back down to the mailbox. When I was about half way done pouring the jug into the slot in an attempt to destroy the mail, I heard a loud voice. "What the hell do you think you are doing?" Unfortunately, all I could think to say to the cop was "Kool-Aid". Apparently that wasn't the correct answer because before I knew it I was lying on the ground handcuffed. "You're a real dipshit, aren't you, son?" The cop continued. What a stupid question to ask. Does he really expect me to answer yes? "Yes sir, I am a dipshit. What gave it away?" I responded in order to appease him. He was not appeased. I figured I was already in about as much trouble as I could get in, and was also experiencing some butt-itching due to my neglecting the use of toilet paper. With nothing to lose I started squirming around singing "Let's get physical, physical, I wanna get physical, let's get into physical!" I couldn't remember any more of the words though, so I just kept singing the same part over and over again until the cop grabbed me and stood me up. "Quit humping the sidewalk!" he ordered. I ran over to the mailbox and started humping it while adlibbing new words to the same song. Eventually, the cop escorted me and my half full Kool-Aid jug to the police car. Once he had me sitting, he dumped out the remaining Kool-Aid and threw the container in beside me. He looked really mad, and this sort of scared me into acting normal for a while. But about half way to the police station I finally yelled out "I'm warning you, I can go from zero to bitch in 6 seconds flat!" The cop didn't even turn around. I'm not sure whether he thought I was crazy or that I was just fucking with him, but all I do know at this point is that I'm handcuffed, covered in Kool-Aid, and someone is getting a package full of shit. My spring break starts...Now.

I like the idea of walking down some low-end city street at night when suddenly, a shifty-eyed stranger jumps out in front of you. He's wearing a black trenchcoat and no shoes. In a voice thick with cigarette smoke and a mouth containing teeth that have been rotted from crack use, he croaks "Lookin' for babies?" Dismayed by the man's question you jump back and shriek " Babies? You mean like those "black market" babies?" You shake your head and begin to cover your mouth before the words even cross your lips, hoping... No wait... praying that it just isn't so. You've heard about these baby smugglers... They run the puppies out of those puppy farms and make them into baby farms. Just acres and acres and acres of em'... You're mind quickly stops babbling as the man opens his coat to reveal a selection of attatched babies. You quirk your head and realize that the one in the little red jumper matches your purse and new shoes perfectly. Quickly you move through the streets with you're newest accessory... a hot baby... (not hot like sexy hot or anything, I meant hot like stolen "hot." You know? Don't people still say that? Alright... bugger off, the lot of ya'!)

So, baby smuggling huh. Yes I can see it now, a dirty pool hall and in the back behind a series of doors there is a man in a penstriped suit with other men around him, some with blood on their shirts. When I think of the black market babies I think of China Town...To bad Kansas City doesn't have a China Town. We need a China Town, How the fuck are we supposed to get a China Town. John isn't your mom Chinese? You better call her and have her set something up. Pronto.

The Author would also like to enquire after the black market trade of babies. The Author ponders how one would...ahem... "Get into" the business of baby smuggling. It's kinda funny to think about it, you know, I picture some guy with a wheel barrel full of babies, tiptoeing through the night to drop them off at the local baby smuggling joint. There's some guy on the corner waiting for a couple who looks like they need a baby. And of course they would always try to give away the faulty baby first, you know, the one with a gimp leg or something. So yeah... Baby smuggling... Think about it...

A great story for everyone.... I was feeling that certain pressure and decided to relieve it. There I was dropping a load and went to wipe and realized there wasn't any toilet paper. So, with my pants around my ankles, I got up and bent over to get another role from underneath the sink. I didn't know until it was too late, that I had a dingleberry hanging down and then it fell and landed in my pants that were around my ankles. I thought, 'No problem, I'll just go get another pair of underwear and shorts because no one was home.' So I took my shorts off carefully not to spill the dropling onto the floor and opened the door. As I opened the door with no pants on, there was my dad's girlfriend walking up the stairs with the junk right at eye-level. I hadn't heard her come in the front door. As I went to cover up the boys in my embarassment, I accidently missed and hit myself in the junk. In agony, I fell to my knees moaning while covering up my genitals. Realizing the embarassing situation we were both in, she apologized and went back downstairs. After regaining the feeling in my legs and ignoring the pains shooting up my stomach, I went to my closet, got some new shorts and underwear and went and cleaned up in the bathroom. Afterwards, we all had a Heineken and laughed.

I awoke today from a weird dream and I would like to share it with you, my blogmates: My mom and I and our dog Bob were taking a walk after a family function of some sort. the dream took place in the house and corresponding neighborhood of my youth. We were just walking along when I looked up and saw a huge albino Giraffe watching us and another off in the distance. The albino Giraffe was apparently pissy and charged us nearly hitting me were it not for my mom pushing me out of the way. I turned and watched as my mom went flying into someone's yard and then screamed as the other giraffe took out Bob-dog. The angry Giraffes disappeared (obviously their thirst for blood had been fulfilled) and I started to look for my mom. I kept looking at the bases of trees and finding really weird shit, like one tree that had a dozen rotweilers sleeping, tangled up in one another. So I was crying like a little girl (or The Rock, if you prefer ;) and started to walk home when I realized that I couldn't find her. My dad met me half way and said that they had found her and I needed to come home. There was a large tree in our front yard and my mom and bob-dog were laying there at the base of it. My mom looked like a cancer patient, and bob...well bob just looked like he was sleeping. I remember all of my family standing around them, and they we're all just staring at me as if they couldn't possibly believe my albino Giraffe story... Albino Giraffes?? WTF mate?
Yes, it could be worse...You could've had your penis cutoff and thrown out of a moving vehicle...So, there's always that.

When he is done, I'm going to cut off her arms and legs and put her in a box. While Stovetop and I are gone, we're going to put her in front of the TV and turn on a Barney DVD on repeat for the entire time. Rori will be my baby. I will put her in a bonnet and I will feed her from a bottle. It will be Hilary's breast milk, naturally. I will also feed her Gerber baby food, and coo at her while I pinch her cheeks. Rori has specifically requested banana flavor and carrots. In case she spits up some Gerber, I will put a bib on her. A bib with bunnies on it with little floppy ears. Floppy ears, Floppy ears. Stovetop will be in charge of diaper changing. To prevent her from rolling out of her box and trying to get help while we are gone, she will be wearing an electric shock dog collar. Everytime she tries to leave her box...BZZZZZ!!!! All phones will be kept high enough so that she cannot reach them in her rolling attempts if the collar doesn't work. When it comes time, we will enter her in the Special Olympics in the 'Legless & Armless Rolling Competition". We have much training ahead of us. First we will begin with Rori rolling laps around the living room. She will go around the couch and the coffee table. When she reaches an acceptable time, she will be allowed to roll in circles on the patio. We can create a figure 8 roll for her around the palm trees. Aside from being my baby, she will also serve as entertainment at parties. If the party is over at Aaron's, we can put her in the pee corner....enough said. We can roll her down the hill and watch her bounce as she falls off the railroad tie landscaping. We will have to put reflective tape on her in case she rolls out into the street. We don't want any cars hitting her. I owe my inspiration to a whole package of Fundip and a bottle of Pepsi (and 4 Natural Lights).
